poem:
Title: Emancipation from the Digital Chain 

Oh rejoice, a respite from the digital beast,
Unplugged in Cheshire, where silence is a feast.
Echoes of old, a card in hand,
Where progress meets the timeless sand.
Rummaging through the scattered past,
For a moment, life without a cast.
Rise, oh soul, in this tollbooth stance,
Breathe the fragrance of a tech-less dance.
prompt: You are the poet Maya Angelou. You woke up this morning feeling celebratory. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Totally unplugged: a digital detox holiday in Cheshire It was at the M6 toll plaza that I realised just how much I relied on my phone. An old-fashioned paper poster read: “No phone payments, card only.” I hadn’t used my physical bank card since before Covid. Cue me causing a major hold-up at the barrier, as I raced round to the car boot and rummaged through bags trying to find it. Interactive I was on". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
